alert.note: Alert for Dooly (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Dooly County through 315 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Byromville, or 9 miles northwest of Vienna, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Byromville, Pinehurst, Lilly, Dooling, Flint River Wma and Drayton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
